text:
1: DK Jungle Climber, it's the only one I have played and I thought it was pretty fun.
2: Donkey Kong Country 2: Diddy's Kong quest - Snakey Chantey.
3: I have never played it but it looks pretty tedious and mediocre.
4: funky Kong, and I don't know why.
author: Mojojojo X

text:
1. The second one :3
2.Is hard to say xD
3. No.
4. Diddy !
author: amaillo

text:
Seven down, three more to go!

Thanks for providing the soundtrack to my University years!
author: Justin Macak

text:
1. My favorite game in the series is a tie between DKC 2 and DKC 3 on GBA, for the sake of nostalgia.

2. I'd say my favorite theme in the series, as of right now, is Nuts and Bolts from the GBA version of DKC 3. That track has such a cool vibe!

3. I've never actually played Donkey Kong 64. I'll have to try it some time.


4. My favorite Kong has to be Dixie as well. You just can't deny, that hair has some serious power!
author: Moop Bread

text: The GBA version of DKC 3 is FAR superior to it's SNES counterpart. David Wise SERIOUSLY rocked the GBA with the re-worked soundtrack!
author: Moop Bread

text: DKC > Mario
author: dcg748

text:
1) 2 is my favorite but unlike most fans its closely followed by 3. What can I say, I'm a fan of gimmicky levels
2) Either, Hot Head Bop, Stickerbrush Symphony, or Gang Plank Galleon
3) Not really, I love the Banjo Kazooie series but it just feels wrong and clunky when put in this game and with the Kongs. Even Kirkhopes (a composer a dearly love) score just doesnt feel right for me
4) Dixie! Though I do very much love Diddy
author: Venagade

text:
1. Donkey Kong Country Returns is the only one that I have played, so I guess that one wins by default.
2. My favorite DKC theme is, without a doubt, the rocket barrel theme from DKCR. I have to actually disagree with you about DKCR's soundtrack. I find many of its themes to be highly enjoyable and extremely memorable, such as the rocket barrel, the mine cart, Tidal Terror, the Mole Train, the music level from the factory, and the Tikis' intro themes.
3. I've never played it.
4. No one can compare to the snide remarks courtesy of my dear Cranky Kong.
author: DScribbleF

text:
1: DKC2, has best presentation
2: The intro music to DKC1
3: I played it and enjoyed it a lot, but hated the characters besides diddy and donkey. 
4: Diddy

How do you feel about diddy kong racing? I think it's the best kart racer because of it's hard difficulty, 3 vehicles, exploration type gameplay, multileveled powerups and that let go of accelerate to get more boost mechanic. Also bosses in a racing game? Wow.
author: FrogFraction

text:
1. DKC 2
2. Mining Mleancholy (Kanon's Klaim)
3.No
4.Diddy
author: Griflion

text: i really love Aquatic Ambiance and Ice Cave Chant(i think it's called).i'm leaning towards the 2nd for my fave game in the franchise.i haven't played Donkey Kong 64 and my favorite Kong is Dixie as well :) cute and i love that hovering spin
author: SirenoftheVoid

text:
1. Donkey Kong Country 3. I played that one first, and I have fond memories of it. I think that DKC3 has more variety than DKC2 and DKC1, and a superb OST. I wasn't fond of Kiddy Kong, but it didn't stop me from loving the game.
2. Forest Interlude.
3. I wasn't a fan at all, don't like that game.
4. Diddy Kong.
author: Happytreefriendsfan3

text:
1. Tough one. I think I have to go with Donkey Kong Country Returns with the first Donkey Kong country for the SNES as a strong runner-up. What a bunch of awesome games and memories!

2.Donkey Kong Country - Fear Factory (SNES) Amazing ambiance. Although there are so many  great ones. The Aquatic Ambiance theme is really soothing too.

3.No, it sucked donkey balls.

4.Cranky Kong! I want to be a bitter smart-ass when sitting on all the important answers in life, Whipper-snappers!
author: knasbollicus

text:
The point is that DK64 is like a Banjo Kazooie game instead of a DKC game. It's not that DKC-ish, despite the obvious influences. But it also depends on your preference. N64 platformers tended to not have much platforming, you know? There was more exploring and problem solving with big open worlds instead of any challenging jumps. The game that started it, Super Mario 64, had the most platform-y level design. (example: tick tock clock)

I love DK64 anyways though.
author: dorko4u

text:
1. Donkey Kong Country Returns is my favorite, although I completely agree with your complaints about the game.

2. My favorite theme is Frantic Factory from DK64. That's not technically DKC so otherwise I'd go with Mining Melancholy.

3. I totally get it, DK64 is a flawed game, but I can enjoy it despite its flaws. It's relaxing as it is, tho I do wish it had actual platforming, yaknow? There's also the nostalgia due to it being my first DK game.

4. Best Kong is Chunky Kong!
author: dorko4u

text: 1. DKC2 2. Mining Melancholy 3. Never played it and don't really care to 4. Gotta love Cranky Kong
author: Chicken Guru

text:
1. DKC2 is definitely my favourite, although 1 and 3 are pretty close.
2. For the sake of putting a name: Jib Jig. But really, I could pick pretty much anything from DKC2.
3. Never played it.
4. Diddy. I like his fast movement.
author: VoxAcies

text:
1:Donkey Kong country 2: Diddy's Kong-quest

2: Crocodile Cacophony (someone on OCremix made a metallized version of this song part of an album called Serious Monkey Business.)

3. I never played DK64, but I've tons of videos and runs of it. It would be great if you didn't have to collect so. much. stuff. It's almost like Rare's programmers had insane amounts of OCD. 

4. Dixie. hands down. So excited to see her in tropical freeze. the kongs need some love.
author: Enclavefakesoldier

text: So what if DK64 is a Banjo clone? It's still a great, great game.
author: Project Lucky

text:
1. Donkey Kong 64
2. Jungle Japes and the music of Frantic Factory
3. Donkey Kong 64 is my second favorite game of all time. I find it much better than Banjo-Kazooie and it pisses me off whenever people blindly hate on it.
4. Donkey Kong, with Funky Kong as a close second. Respect to Lanky though
author: mariosonic10

text:
1. DKC2
2. funky's fugue, mining melancholy, rockface rumble
3. never played it
4. Dixie
author: TheBirdftw

text:
1. DKC2
2.Forest Interlude 
3. I haven't played it. 
4. Diddy 
Keep making the list! I admire your work!
author: Joona Vuoristo

text: im still playing it x)!
author: Arcade Horse

text:
1. Donkey Kong Country 2
2. Stickerbrush Symphony, Aquatic Ambience, Jib Jig, Hot Head Bop... so many!
3. I didn't play it much as a kid, but I revisited it recently and found little compulsion to continue playing it.  It did feel like a not-as-good Banjo Kazooie.
4. Haha, Cranky Kong; he couldn't care less about the fourth wall!
author: JavaSplice555

text:
1. Donkey Kong Country
2. Gang-Plank Galleon (DKC1)
3. Never played but will try it out sometime
4. Diddy Kong
author: Rdannylor2

text:
1. DKC2. It's a masterpiece in every aspect. 
2. Forest Interlude
3. Played and enjoyed. Apart from the amazing graphics that holds well also today (not a common thing speaking of N64), I found it very fun to play. But I've to say that I always play with it without trying to collect everything, so I didn't lose my mind in some painfully hard bonus games and stuff... Obviously, I didn't like the soundtrack, coming from the DKC series I had some expectations...
4. Donkey Kong. The tie!!!
author: COBOL

text:
1. Donkey Kong Country
2. GB version of In a Snow-Bound Land
3. Played through it in its entirety and enjoyed it as a kid, and I still like most of the content in it, like boss battles, atmosphere, music, etc., but today, all the tedious collecting required to reach that content is just way too much of a pain for me to bother. The game is a chore to play.
4. Diddy Kong
author: Cheeseman

text:
1. DKC2
2. Sticker Brush Symphony
3. I like DK64 and finished it, but it's not so good that I'd want to play it again.
4. Diddy, but it's more fun to play as Dixie.
author: Adam Epp

text:
1. Donkey Kong Country 2- it did a lot of new things without being too gimmicky.

2. Stickerbrush Symphony

3. HELL NO. It was the collect-a-thon brought to the level of self-parody. But there was one good thing about it...

4. Lanky Kong!
author: David E.

text:
1. I've only beaten the first DKC, but I actually like DKC2 more.

2. Honestly, I can't choose, but I will say that DKC2 has the perfect soundtrack. Every track is just amazing (from Stickerbrush to the volcano to Forest Interlude to Bayou Boogie...). Very few games have such perfect soundtracks...

3. No. Got too tedious near the end with a lot of repeated elements and mini-games. Everything seemed forced, unlike games like Banjo-Kazooie. It didn't seem fun at all.

4. Diddy
author: myohel0

text:
1) DKC 3 (hard decision, but i love the open overworld and the banana bird caves)
2) Forest Interlude, In a snow-bound land, Mining Melancholy and of course AquAmb & StiBruSym
3) I liked DK64 but not as much as every DKC game. (The best thing i remember is how deep you get in that one cave in the tower level, where you get deeper and deeper and in the end there is this minecart passage with donkey kong, very dark atmosphere)
4) Cranky
author: coherent911

text:
1.) Donkey Kong Country 2.
2.) Forest Interlude and Foggy Fumes.
3.) I loved DK64!
4.) Diddy Kong.
author: Mega1337Gamer

text: I really like DK 64 a lot too, don't know why that gets bashed by some fans as just a dumb collect-a-thon. The level design was amazing in it and loved getting new powers to use. PLus the multiplayer was a fun time killer. Still remember how epic it felt having to get a new graphics card for my N64 just to play the thing!
author: SkepticalFox

text:
1. DKC2 (best Snes platformer?)
2. Mining Melancholy (DKC2)
3. I used to be a fan. Not anymore. DK64 did not stand the test of time.
4. Diddy!
author: flyingfoxxx1984

text:
1. Donkey Kong 64(i love collectathon games)
2. In a Snow-Bound Land DKC 2
3. as said i think DK64 is the best donkey kong game, and i find it to be superior to Banjo Kazooie
4. my favorite kong is Diddy
author: kemsus

text:
1. Donkey Kong Country.
2. Stickerbrush symphony.

4. Diddy Kong! :p
author: Otakool 13

text:
Big fan of Gangplank Galleon and Crocodile Cacophony. That said, I don't I heard it until I was about 7 or 8 as I could just never get that far in the game!

DKCR rightfully deserves a mention. I think when you've got a nostalgic memory of a game though, nothing is going to top that. My personal favorutie SNES game is A Link To The Past, and I doubt Nintendo will be able to evoke the same feelings of heroism and achievement as when I first beat the Helmasaur King as a five year old!
author: Chris W

text:
1. Can't decide between DKC1 or 2.
2. Aqautic ambience.
3. never played DK64. Looks alright though.
4. Donkey kong
author: Kiyohime

text:
1.DKC 3 (most time spent playing this entry)
2. Stickerbrush Symphony
3. Not a fan. Only gave it like an hour though.
4. Dixie for sure. Probably why the first DKC is my least favorite of the original trilogy.
author: boyblob

text:
1. Donkey Kong Country.

2. Aquatic Ambiance, Sticker Brush, Forest Interlude.

3. Donkey 64 is an amazing game and prolly my favorite game of all time. Those who have never played it are missing out big time in my opinion! Everything about its atmosphere,music, level design, gameplay, characters are awesome.

4. Donkey Kong.
author: K Kumar

text: Yes, I've played it.  I bought it on release and marathoned it.  Yes, it is plain awful.  No, it is not a really fun game and it is not a worthy iteration in the series (nor is it in the series as it uses very different mechanics than the DKC games).  Although I wouldn't say it destroys the original series (DKC will always be there to play), I can see what they probably mean, which is this is what new players will think DKC is, and it isn't at all.

text:
1. DKC3
2. Hot Puirsuit
3. Never played, and no intention to
4. Diddy Kong

text: 1. Dkc2 2. Ice cave chant 3. Yes love that game. 4. Diddy

text: 1. Dkc2
author: bazla123

text:

text:

author: Narigo1

text: Perfect for your 1400 video! David Wise is a genius :)
author: Nick Roselin Oleksiak

text:
1. DKC2 is my favorite. So many hidden goodies! That elevates it above DKC1 in my mind. That, and the superior soundtrack.

2.I actually like Forest Interlude from DKC2 the best. Of course, Aquatic Ambiance, Stilt Village and Water World (both from DKC3 on GBA) and Fear Factory Returns are all amazing themes as well. Can't go wrong with any of those.

3. Not a fan of DK64. It's the prime example of what's wrong with 'collectathons', problems that also appear in Jet Force Gemini and Banjo.
author: drunyon214

text: Mario and DKC before Megaman huh.  I'm a bit surprised ;)
author: xSayPleasex

text: Have you played it? It's definitely not "plain awful". Returns is a really fun game and a worthy iteration in the series. Nevertheless, it is ridiculously overrated,  with some people saying it destroys the original trilogy (which makes no sense).
author: F4m1LyGuy10

text: Why would you use something from DKCR to represent DKC?!  DKCR is nothing like the rest of DKC, and that goes for its music.  DKCR is just plain awful.  Ugh.
author: totlyepic

text:
(continued from previous)
1) 2 still does it for me (though I haven't played Returns, and not for lack of wanting either)
2) Fear Factory
3) I did like 64. I enjoyed the varied play mechanics and powerups of the various Kongs. Also, too few games with multiple characters really make the final boss feel like such a team effort like DK64 did.
4) Dixie, hair rules.

text:
1. DKC2, the first game I playd thoroughly through. 102% :D

text:
1. Hard to say, DKC1 holds a lot of memories and DKCR was really nice as well. DKC2 probably wins for it being so similar to DKC1 but with an OST more in my taste

text: My fav is DK1 followed by DK2. Love those games to death, and I wish I could play them on the 3DS.
author: sonideromex

text:
Is it true that the first game soundtrack was composed by Fischer/Wise, the second one only by Wise and the third by Fischer ??
I always thought that the 3 games soundtracks was composed by the 2 of them !
author: 7Sep7

text:
1. DKC2, best soundtrack, level desing and mood. Oh, the nostalgia.
2. Forest interlude, so soothing and beautiful
3. DK64 was very enjoyable at times, it had superb level design and dynamic gameplay between different characters and their unique attributes. Too bad it repeated same bosses and mini games over and over again. Weak compared with the SNES cousins, but a rather underrated N64 game in my opinion.
4. Diddy Kong, I've always loved that smart-ass
author: Kookosbanaani94

text:
1. DKC 1
2. Gang-Plank Galleon
3. I liked DK 64.
4. My favorite is Chunky Kong and Funky Kong.

text: Although, I will say Stickerbrush Symphony is 3rd favorite for question number 2.
author: kingmonster

text:
Cool!  Glad DKC Returns got a place here on the 100 numbers.  :)

1. I like em' all, but number 2 just stands out for me.
2. While "Flight of the Zingers" is my top favorite, "Miners Melancholy" is a close second.
3. It was okay...just not enough to be my favorite game.
4. Donkey Kong, of course!
author: kingmonster

text: No rocket barrel soundtrack of DKCR yet?
author: Ggamefreak22

text:
1. All three of the SNES games.
2. Too many favorites to pick.
3. DK64 did feel like a Banjo clone, but I mostly just disliked how slow it felt compared to the 2-D platformers. I did have some fun with it though in the short time I played it in.
4. I am cut between Diddy and Dixie.
author: A M

text:
1. DKC2
2. I have 3 favourites Aquatic Ambience, Stickerbush Symphony and Rockface Rumble
3. I have always enjoyed DK64, it had good levels, memmorable music and that special N64 atmosphere that I like
4. I guess I have to go with Donkey Kong, since he's the strongest character, a single jump on any enemy is enough while diddy had to roll on or jump over many of the enemies

text: DKC2 had the difficulty curve, soundtrack, and creative boss battles the first and third lacked.

text:

author: Engie's Video Game Music Dispenser

text:

text:

2) Misty Menace from DKC

author: Sharpie473

text:
1. DKC3 - Most people don't agree, but I thought the game was great. I loved the atmosphere and interactive world.

2. Life in the Mines Returns from DKCR - One of the few times a remix surpassed the original. 

3. Yes! - Rare always does a good job with platformers. I'm actually surprised so many people here don't like it. 

4. Cranky Kong - DK wouldn't be the same without that angry codger.

DKC2

text:
1. DKC2 is my favorite. 1 is actually my least favorite oddly. 
2. Uh.... I don't know. Overall 2's OST is the strongest, but I really like Treetop Tumble and Rockface Rumble from 3.... can't pick just one track, sorry. :)
3. Nope, nope nope. Didn't like it. I like 3D platformers just fine, but that just wasn't a great one. :/
4. Dixie for sure. I hope she's in Smash for Wii U and 3DS.

text:
1. DKC2
2. Lockjaw's Locker
3. Can I say mixed?

author: Catsthatshootlasers

text:
1. DKC2, definitely. 1 lacked polish, 3 was too gimmicky, and I've never played Returns.
2. Stickerbrush Symphony.
3. I liked DK64 just because I like collectathons. However, having to constantly switch between characters and backtrack made the game much worse than Banjo Tooie.
4. Diddy's the man.
author: TargetHippo

text:
Wait *4* playable characters?!

Donkey, Diddy, Dixie...who is the fourth?
author: neoswordmaster

text:
1. DKC2.
2. World Map theme from DKC1.
3. I'm a fan of DKC but it's ok. I don't really feel the need to replay it mainly due to how long it can take compared to Banjo Kazooie. Still enjoy it & its soundtrack.
4. Favorite Kongs are Lanky and Chunky. Both of them crack me up (particularly Chunky's idle animation in DK64).
author: CaboosesApprentice

text:
1. DKC2 or DKCR
2. Mining Melancholy
3. It's a great game, but a terrible DK game. It's pretty much a Banjo game with other characters and it has excessive... random humor that makes it feel rather... annoying.
4. Donkey Kong, he's the main guy.

And holy crap, can't wait for Tropical Freeze. Even more now that I hear Wise is composing the soundtrack. Yamamoto unfortunately isn't made for DKC, except for the remixes.
author: Alfonso ST

text:
1) dkc2, no contest.
2) forest interlude
3) I was very meh about it. I didnt hate it, but nor did i really like it.
4) Despite the game he's from, i gotta give it to my man Chunky. So hilarious.
author: philip0544

text: Favourite game in the series is DKC2.  Favourite theme is a tie between Stickerbrush Symphony and Enchanted Wood.  I liked Donkey Kong 64, but consider it the weakest out of their platforming trinity of with Banjo Kazooie and Banjo Tooie.  I loved Grant Kirkhope's compositions for the game though.  I'm tied for Dixie and Diddy in terms of favourite kong.  DKC3 just felt fake in terms of difficulty because of how bulky and slow Kiddy was.  Diddy and Dixie had the best chemistry in terms of a duo.
author: SMRPGFAN101

text:
1) DKC2

2) My gut is to go with either the obvious Aquatic Ambience or Stickerbrush Symphony, but I'll go with Swanky's Swing

3) I loved it at the time, but I haven't come back to it much. Unlike you, I replay games a lot, so a big part of my assessment is whether it entices me to play thru it again. I only played all the way thru it twice. I still think it's a decent game though.

4) Diddy
author: GoRedskinsAndWizards

text: It's a shame to see you're not a fan of DK64.
author: Hawlo

text: Is it only me that likes DKC3 better than the other two? And mind you, it's not the weight of nostalgia: I played all of them as a kid!
author: Zenju

text: I've been subscribed to your videos for so long because your love for king and country. keep making awesome videos.
author: NoahHacksaw

text:
1. DKC2, though DKCR is a close second.
2. Tie between Mining Melancholy, Hot Head Hop, Forest Interlude and Stickerbrush Symphony.

4. Dixie, probably.
author: Limopalise

text:
1. DKC2
2. Kannon's Klaim
3. I loved it, but after playing Banjo and Conker I'll admit my love for it still is most likely from nostalgia(I got a N64 late and it was my first 3D game ever, not to mention the only game the entire family could get behind, so very personal for me)
4. Very hard to say between Diddy and Dixie. Diddy seems more fun as a character but when it comes to gameplay, Dixie was always my choice. So a tie.
Tropical Freeze is a Day 1 purchase here. I can't wait!

text:
1. DKC3, Tis the only one I've played and I really love the game.

2. Not really sure Stickerbush Symphony from the second one is pretty good.

3. only played it a little over my cuz's house it was good fun but I don't know how well it would hold up for a full game.

4. Diddy.
author: TheDemonicDude

text:

author: roundthewheel

text:

author: Link8150

text:
DKC3 does get a lot of undeserved hate. I don't understand all the "light hearted setting" comments. It has some of the darkest levels in the series. Also, Eveline didn't compose all of DKC3's soundtrack; David composed 9 of the songs. As for the questions:

1. DKC3
2. Gang-Plank Galleon
3. Never played it, but I agree with your sentiment.
4. Diddy
author: F4m1LyGuy10

text:
1. DKCR -- it just felt so more full, but it didn't lose any of the spirit of the originals.
2. Would it be cheating to say Dance of the Zinger? (Actual choice: Snakey Chantey)
3. Never played it, but I always wanted to. It strikes me as the type of game that would be right up my alley.
4. Diddy
author: Huramibit

text:
1. DK3, nine times outta ten I'd probably just say 2, but right now I'm feeling 3. First game gets love for being my first snes game owned (not played though).

2. Currently Arctic Abyss.

3. I still hold a grudge against 64 for not simply being DKC4, introducing Lanky Kong (blue lahooooo), and for being possibly the worst n64 title to come from Rare who otherwise were putting out masterpieces. I don't feel it's a bad game, but I wish it had been the best game of my ever, OF MY EVER.

4. Funky.
author: Chris Taylor

text:
1) DK 1
2) Fear Factory / Funky's Fugue
3) I hate DK64 
4) Donkey Kong Rules!
author: Franco Gutierrez

text:
What do you think of DK Jungle Beat? 

I'm currently playing through DKCReturns on the 3ds, and while I love not having to put up with the Wii's wiimote shaking mechanics, I hate how easy it is to accidentally start rolling when I try to bongo the ground or blow on stuff.
author: Chris Taylor

text:
1. DKC1, although 2 is a very very close second.
2. Mine Cart Carnage from the classics (although Aquatic Ambience and Stickerbrush Symphony and some others are equally amazing), and Palm Tree Groove is awesome from Returns.
3. I never played DK64 as a kid, and while I love that genre and it has great music, and some good level design, it's a little too tedious and annoying compared to Banjo-Kazooie and Tooie. I don't own a copy though, so I haven't played much.
4. Diddy
author: doorknob60

text:
1. Fore some reasons, the 3rd one
2. Rattle Battle (DKC2)
3. I never played it when I was younger... So I cannot feel nostalgic with it and I did not play that much to judge (But Banjo is on my top 3 series)
4. Kiddy Kong

Wise is coming back? I was excited before, but now I've got hype.... uh oh.

author: guitarskills2

text:
1. That's a good question. Its a toss up between DKC1 & 2. If I had to pick probably the first, but they're both amazing. 

2. I love Aquatic Ambiance as well. One of my favorite songs is actually the Water World theme from the GBA remake of DKC3. Forest Interlude and Stickerbrush Symphony are fantastic too. 

3. I actually have yet to play DK64. I will eventually. 

4. Cranky Kong!

author: Mugifi

text: And another 100 done! In the video, I mention that DKC is my 2nd favorite platformer series behind Mario, but that's without counting Castlevania which would be my #2. Since half the games are platformers and the other half are metroidvanias, I put that series apart.
